courseInfo.prerequisite: Basic knowledge of Python (variables, loops, functions). Familiarity with fundamental programming concepts.

rationale: Development of application systems and software that use underlying architecture of machines efficiently and effectively requires the ability to use and manipulate various types of Data Structures and other constructs. This being a fundamental ability which is language neutral yet requires use of a language for its implementation. As far as data structures are concerned, the course covers Python dictionaries as well as classes and objects for defining user defined data types such as linked lists and binary search trees. This course is designed to develop an integrated ability to efficient software development and apply the knowledge to various application systems; hence this course is very important for IT diploma engineers.

courseOutcomes.description: Understand linear and non-linear data structures.
Implement Object Oriented Programming concepts in Python.
Implement basic data structures such as stacks, queues.
Develop and manipulate linked lists with various operations.
Apply algorithms for solving problems like searching and sorting of data.
Implement nonlinear data structures like trees.

content: 1.3 Analysis Terms (for the definitions purpose only):
• Time Complexity, Space Complexity, Asymptotic Notations
• Big 'O' Notation, Best case Time Complexity
• Average case Time Complexity, Worst case Time Complexity
1.5 Array in Python, import array, import numpy, Operations on Arrays, Arrays vs List
• Instance method, Class method, static method
• Infix, Prefix and Postfix Forms of Expressions
3.6 Operations on Queue - Enqueue and Dequeue
3.11 Differentiate circular queue and simple queue
4.3 Basic operations on singly linked list:
• Insertion of a new node in the beginning of the list
• At the end of the list, after a given node, before a given node
• Deleting the first and last node from a linked list
• Count the number of nodes in linked list
4.5 Difference between circular linked list and singly linked list
• Bubble Sort, Selection Sort, Quick Sort, Insertion Sort, Merge Sort
6.2 Basic Terms: level number, degree, in-degree and out-degree, leaf node
• Insertion of a node in binary tree
• Deletion of a node in binary tree
• Searching a node in binary tree

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Write a program to read a list of elements. Modify this list so that it does not contain any duplicate elements, i.e., all elements occurring multiple times in the list should appear only once.
Implement a Program for two matrix multiplication using simple nested loop and NumPy module.
Design an employee class for reading and displaying the employee information, the getInfo() and displayInfo() methods will be used respectively. Where getInfo() will be a private method.
Design a class Complex for adding the two complex numbers and also show the use of constructor.
Design a class for single level, multiple and hierarchical inheritance using public and private type derivation.
Write a Python program to demonstrate method overriding using inheritance.
Implement a program to convert infix notation to postfix notation using stack.
Implement a program to implement QUEUE using list that performs following operations: ENQUEUE, DEQUEUE, DISPLAY

Implement program to perform following operation on singly linked list: a. Insert a node at the beginning of a singly linked list. b. Insert a node at the end of a singly linked list. c. Insert a node after the given node of a singly linked list. d. Insert a node before the given node of singly linked list. e. Delete a node from the beginning of a singly linked list. f. Delete a node from the end of a singly linked list. g. Count the number of nodes of a singly linked list. h. Display content of singly linked list
Implement a python program to search a particular element from list using Linear and Binary Search.
Implement Bubble sort, Selection sort, Insertion sort and Merge sort algorithm.

Write a menu driven program to perform following operation on Binary Search Tree: a. Create a BST. b. Insert an element in BST. c. Pre-order traversal of BST. d. In-order traversal of BST. e. Post-order traversal of BST. f. Delete an element from BST

laboratoryResources.resourceName: Computer system with operating system: Windows 7 or higher version or MacOS or Linux, RAM 4GB or higher, Python version: 2.7.X, 3.6.X or higher
laboratoryResources.specifications: Computer system with operating system: Windows 7 or higher version or MacOS or Linux, RAM 4GB or higher, Python version: 2.7.X, 3.6.X or higher

laboratoryResources.resourceName: Python IDEs and Code Editors Open Source : IDLE, Jupyter
laboratoryResources.specifications: Python IDEs and Code Editors Open Source : IDLE, Jupyter

projectList.title: Maze Solver using Breadth-First Search (Queue)
projectList.description: Implement a maze-solving application using BFS, where the maze is represented as a graph. The program finds the shortest path from the entry to the exit, making it useful in robotics and game development.

projectList.title: File Version Control using Stack
projectList.description: Develop a version control system where each change to a file is stored in a stack (LIFO). Users can revert to previous versions by popping changes from the stack. This mimics how undo/redo functionalities work in text editors and software development tools.

projectList.title: Student Records Management using Binary Search Tree (BST)
projectList.description: This project allows users to manage student records efficiently using a BST. Each node represents a student, storing details like name, ID, and marks. The BST enables quick searching, insertion, and deletion of records based on student IDs. Additional features can include sorting students based on marks and displaying the top performers.

studentActivities: Develop a DS-based Application - Build projects like a contact book (linked lists), task scheduler (heaps), or inventory system (queues & stacks) using advanced Python concepts.
Explore Libraries - Use NumPy, pandas, or NetworkX to analyze and manipulate data structures efficiently.
API Integration - Fetch and process real-world data (e.g., weather, stock prices) using REST APIs and store them in hash tables or graphs.
Competitive Coding - Solve data structure challenges on LeetCode, HackerRank, or Codewars to enhance problem-solving skills.
